item.title: Springtime/Easter Week
item.description: For the last three days of spring break, the older two kiddos went away for a few days.

item.title: Saint Patrick's Day
item.description: G6 has made a request for more theme weeks, and we kicked off the new run of them with Saint Patrick’s Day!

item.title: Space Activity Day
item.description: For ski week, I asked each of the kids what they most hoped to do in that week.

item.title: Snowy Preschool Day
item.description: G3’s third theme request of the school year was snow. I had a lot of fun putting this one together, but I did find that it lent itself more to sensory exploration than numbers, alphabet, and so on, so it was harder to balance out the types of activities.

item.title: Dinosaur Preschool Day
item.description: G3’s second request for her own themed “camp” day was dinosaurs!

item.title: Thanksgiving
item.description: The kids had the whole week off for Thanksgiving break this year!

item.title: Flower Day
item.description: My 3 year old girl is an absolute sweetheart. She talks about our summer camps all the time.

item.title: Social Studies Focus: World Geography
item.description: I provided the kids with large-scale outlines of all the continents (except Antarctica).

item.title: Fairy Tale Fun Day 3: The Snow Queen
item.description: Once again, we started off camp by reading the story of the day.

item.title: Fairy Tale Fun Day 2: Ali Baba and the 40 Thieves
item.description: I started off our day by pretending the door to go outside to our camp space was stuck.

item.title: Fairy Tale Fun Day 1: Rumplestiltskin
item.description: I started off my reading my kiddos Rumplestiltskin. I found a version already edited for kids, and only wanted to change a few small details.

item.title: Dino Days #2
item.description: Our second day of dinosaur activities started out by making salt dough to create our own dinosaur and bone figurines.

item.title: Dino Days #1
item.description: Before camp, I baked dinosaur figurines into “rocks” made from salt dough plus instant coffee for colour.

item.title: Space Camp Day 5
item.description: On the final day of space camp, I started by holding out a bowl of eggs.

item.title: Space Camp Day 4
item.description: We started off Thursday by heading to a spot down the street that I was reasonably confident would stay sunny throughout the day.

item.title: Space Camp Day 3
item.description: On Wednesday, we started out by painting our own planets! I’d picked up a large styrofoam ball for each of the kids, and we came back to this activity a few times throughout the day so they could let it dry between painting different sections, making it easier to hold.

item.title: Space Camp Day 2
item.description: The first thing I had the kids do on Tuesday was make a design on some construction paper to set out for solar printing.

item.title: Space Camp Day 1
item.description: To kick off space camp, we all worked together to create our own colored versions of each planet.

item.title: Animal Camp Day 5: Forest
item.description: Our first activity for forest day was to go on a little nature walk.

item.title: Animal Camp Day 4: Jungle
item.description: Thursday was Jungle day! We started off with a bit of an adventure through the jungle.

item.title: Animal Camp Day 3: Savanna
item.description: First up this day was making giraffes. This was definitely a product-based art project, which isn’t very like me, but I though they had a bit of merit in the motor skills needed for their construction, and plus, turning them into marionettes gave the kids a type of toy they’d never explored before!

item.title: Animal Camp Day 2: Australia
item.description: Tuesday of animal camp was dedicated to animals from Australia.

item.title: Animal Camp Day 1: Arctic
item.description: Over the weekend, I froze some arctic animal figurines in blocks of ice (to get them in the middle, I froze a layer of water first, then added the figure and more water before freezing again).

item.title: Harry Potter Camp Day 5
item.description: On the way to work, I hid some unicorn toys in the trees at a local park.

item.title: Harry Potter Camp Day 4
item.description: We had another letter arrive by owl post today. Aragog let us know that he’d come by and left a challenge, and those who could successfully make it through his web would win house points!

item.title: Harry Potter Camp Day 3
item.description: We started off the day with a challenge: could they make Harry’s glasses - and attach a scar - using pipe cleaners?

item.title: Harry Potter Camp Day 2
item.description: On Tuesday, the kids came to camp to discover nothing but an owl with a message for them - Peeves had stolen all the supplies for the day’s activities!

item.title: Harry Potter Camp Day 1
item.description: My kiddos knew that I was running a themed camp this week, but I’d asked their mum not to tell them what the theme would be.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I began my career as an in-home childcare provider in 2013.

item.title: Childcare Philosophy
item.description: My childcare philosophy hinges on the idea that children learn through interacting with their environment.

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.description: What childcare experience do you have? I have been an in-home childcare provider since 2013.

item.title: Portfolio
item.description: In this space, you will find the components that make up most of the portfolio I have in-hand for interviews, including my resume, longer descriptions of my experience, letters of recommendation, and certificates.
